summary: There were 14 separate billion-dollar weather and climate disaster events in the U.S. in 2018—with a total cost of at least $91 billion. These costs will likely rise as the climate changes, researchers say. The federal government’s fiscal exposure from climate change is on our High Risk List . We testified about potential budget impacts from climate change and how the government can reduce fiscal...
title: Climate Change: Opportunities to Reduce Federal Fiscal Exposure
